agreement_title: Communication:  Media Industries and Communication B.A.

general_information.text: DATED MATERIAL, SUBJECT TO CHANGE. PLEASE CONSULT CURRENT UCSD GENERAL CATALOG FOR ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION. Transfer students are highly encouraged to complete coursework that will satisfy IGETC, partial IGETC, or the General Education requirements for the college that they apply to at UC San Diego. The Bachelor of Arts in Media Industries & Communication offers a curriculum in media literacy, institutional analysis, and skills acquisition. Core courses provide a historical and theoretical background for analyzing an increasingly complex media and communication landscape, with a focus on the inner workings of specific sectors (i.e. film, advertising, internet, tourism, etc.). Electives cover a broad range of topics from film analysis to surveillance culture. Students must also take skills-centered practice-based courses in media production, design, and/or other areas. This major welcomes both aspiring media practitioners (filmmakers, musicians, journalists, etc.) and those who aspire to work in media and culture as marketers, managers, digital specialists, lawyers, executives, policy analysts, HR professionals, and more.﻿For more information about on the Media Industries and Communication major please visit our website: http://communication.ucsd.edu

UC San Diego Advanced Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the links below:Advanced Placement (AP) https://www.ucsd.edu/catalog/pdf/APC-chart.pdfInternational Baccalaureate (IB) https://catalog.ucsd.edu/_files/international-baccalaureate-credits-chart.pdf
